suggestions.reason: Anaconda choke is commonly applied from side control after securing the front headlock, making this a critical position-to-submission relationship.
Darce Choke is commonly finished from Front Headlock position, which is explicitly mentioned in the setup requirements.
Turtle Position Top is explicitly listed as a primary starting position for the Darce Choke in the setup requirements.
Twister Setup leads directly to a submission finish, making Won by Submission the natural terminal state for successful execution.
Arm triangle progression typically begins from side control, making this a critical starting position link.
Breadcutter Choke is executed from Side Control Top position, which is the primary starting position for this submission.
Armbar Control is the position state that directly precedes the Straight Armbar submission, representing the control phase before applying finishing pressure.
Terminal state that represents the ultimate goal of a submission-focused strategy, directly aligned with the framework's primary objective.
Flying Armbar starts from standing clinch position, making this the primary starting state for this aerial technique.
Americana is most commonly executed from Side Control, which is explicitly listed as a starting state for this submission.
Straight Footlock is a terminal submission that directly results in match victory, making this the natural end state.
Loop Choke from Mount is executed from the mount position, making this the primary starting position.
Williams Guard is derived from rubber guard/triangle control systems, making this a core related position for the shoulder lock setup.
The arm-in guillotine is a finishing submission that leads directly to this terminal state when successfully applied.
Gogoplata Setup leads directly to a submission finish, making this the natural terminal state for successful execution.
Clock Choke is executed from turtle top position, making this the primary starting position.
The Can Opener submission explicitly states it ends in 'Won by Submission' as the terminal state.
Marce Choke is explicitly described as being executed from front headlock position, making this a critical positional setup link.
Triangle Control is the position that precedes and enables the Triangle Choke submission, representing the control phase before finishing.
Mir Lock is explicitly mentioned as starting from Side Control, making this a critical position-to-submission relationship.
Triangle from Guard is a submission technique that leads to this terminal state when successfully applied

reporting: Report line numbers where links added
